body.p: This page describes the element-by-element mapping from the EHDSCondition logical model to the FHIR Condition profile in this Implementation Guide.

tr.td: Common header for all patient-related data.
Dataset-level; not usually carried in Condition as-is.
Reference to the patient or subject of the condition.
Copy over all identifiers if multiple.
Condition has no generic "author"; use recorder
Can reference Practitioner, PractitionerRole, Patient, RelatedPerson (per profile).
When the resource version was last changed.
FHIR meta.lastUpdated is system-level; EHDS header may carry richer audit info.
Do not confuse with Condition.clinicalStatus or verificationStatus below.
Code identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis.
Identification of the condition, problem, or diagnosis.
CodeableConcept. EHDS binds to ICD-10, SNOMED CT, ICD-O, Orphacode.
Estimated or actual date/time the condition started.
The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission.
When the condition abated or went into remission.
Use abatementDateTime; abatement may also be represented by clinicalStatus = resolved.
Category or categories of the problem (e.g. POA, HAC, other categorisations).
0..* in both models; EHDS may use additional national/organisational codes.
Status of the condition/problem (active, resolved, inactive, ...).
Current clinical status of the condition.
FHIR has a required VS for clinicalStatus; EHDS references HL7 Condition Clinical Status Codes.
Reason for which the status changed from current to inactive (free text if not represented elsewhere).
FHIR Condition has no direct "resolution reason"; use Condition.note (0..*). If your profile defines an extension, point here instead.
Subjective assessment of the severity of the condition.
CodeableConcept; HL7 / SNOMED CT value sets.
The anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.
Anatomical location(s) affected by the condition.
EHDS uses EHDSBodyStructure; map to one or more Condition.bodySite. Use referenced BodyStructure if profiling for more detail.
Stage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.
FHIR also has stage.assessment (Reference). For multiple staging systems, create multiple Condition.stage repetitions.
Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis.
Whether the condition is unconfirmed, provisional, confirmed, refuted, etc.
Both EHDS and FHIR refer to HL7 Condition Verification Status.
Reference to Practitioner / PractitionerRole / Patient / RelatedPerson, depending on profile.
Date and time of the diagnosis assertion.
Date the condition record was first recorded.
Health Professional specifically related to the problem, as a preferred contact.
FHIR R4 Condition has no native participant element; model via an IG-defined extension or via CareTeam.
External resource related to the problem (e.g. guidelines for a rare disease).
Condition.evidence.detail could be used if the IG permits URIs there; otherwise use an extension or evaluate other alternatives
